content: sweet oddity art rainier the dragon crochet pattern https //www etsy com/shop/sweetoddityart copyright 2023 of sweet oddity art you are not allowed to sell this pattern you are not allowed to distribute or publish this pattern in any form you are not allowed to alter this pattern in any form sweet oddity art 1 pattern details size 8 inches from bottom to top of head with weight 4 yarn and a 3 25 mm hook skill level needed intermediate- suitable for novice crocheters requires patience and precisions when assembling the dragon and basic crochet skills contact info if you have any questions or concerns about this pattern please do not hesitate to contact me i will get back to you within 24 hours sweetoddityart@gmail com https //www etsy com/shop/sweetoddityart materials needed yarn worsted weight #6 approximately 150g of main color and 50g of accent colors color a variegated yarn color b black hook size d hook or 3 25 mm 20 mm safety eyes scissors sewing needle stitch marker fiberfill stuffing abbreviations magic_ring= magic_ring- crochet single_crochet stitches in to the adjustable loop blo= back loops only chain= chain stitch f/o= fasten_off single_crochet= single_crochet stitch half_double_crochet= half_double_crochet sl= slip_stitch flo= front loops only bob= bobble st double_crochet= double_crochet stitch inc3= 3 single_crochet in the same stitch inc4= 4 single_crochet in the same st increase= increase- make two single_crochet stitches in the same stitch decrease=decrease- crochet two stitches together using the decrease method 4 single_crochet increase x 6= repeat the pattern between parentheses 6 times notes do not join rounds unless stated work in a continuous spiral use a stitch marker to mark the beginning of each round all stitches are worked in both loops unless stated otherwise in the pattern sweet oddity art 2 head crocheted from front to back of head with color a chain 5 1 increase in 2nd chain from hook 2 single_crochet inc4 working on opposite side of chain 2 single_crochet increase= 12 2 increase x 2 3 single_crochet increase x 3 3 single_crochet increase= 18 3 single_crochet increase x 2 3 single_crochet single_crochet increase x 3 4 single_crochet increase= 24 4 2 single_crochet increase x 2 3 single_crochet 2 single_crochet increase x 3 5 single_crochet increase= 30 5 single_crochet in each st around 6 7 single_crochet bob 4 single_crochet bob 17 single_crochet 7-8 single_crochet in each st around 9 3 single_crochet decrease x 6= 24 10 3 single_crochet increase x 6= 30 11 4 single_crochet increase x 6= 36 12 5 single_crochet increase x 6= 42 13 6 single_crochet increase x 6= 48 place eyes between rounds 12 and 13 leaving 10 holes between them if you want the sunken eye look do not place the backs of the eyes on until round 21 tip you may have to adjust the eye placement depending on yarn and hook size you use 14-18 single_crochet in each st around 19 6 single_crochet decrease x 6= 42 20 5 single_crochet decrease x 6= 36 21 4 single_crochet decrease x
